Speaker: ron stallworth
Dialogue: I went to College.

Speaker: ron stallworth
Dialogue: I have mixed feelings. CHIEF BRIDGES Would you call yourself a Womanizer? RON STALLWORTH No Sir, I would not.

Speaker: ron stallworth
Dialogue: No Sir.

Speaker: chief bridges
Dialogue: Do you drink?

Speaker: ron stallworth
Dialogue: On Special occasions, Sir.

Speaker: ron stallworth
Dialogue: Only those prescribed by My Doctor, Sir.

Speaker: ron stallworth
Dialogue: I know but my Father was in The Military and I was raised up the Right way, Sir.

Speaker: chief bridges
Dialogue: How are you with people, generally?

Speaker: ron stallworth
Dialogue: Sir, they treat me right, I treat them right, like I already said I was raised...

Speaker: chief bridges
Dialogue: ...Have you ever had any negative...

Speaker: ron stallworth
Dialogue: Would that happen...

Speaker: ron stallworth
Dialogue: I know Jackie's Story, Sir.

Speaker: ron stallworth
Dialogue: If I need to, yes, Sir.

Speaker: chief bridges
Dialogue: I'll have your back but I can only do so much. The Weight of this is on You...and You alone.

Speaker: ron stallworth
Dialogue: Cybill Shepherd. She was great in The Last Picture Show.

Speaker: officer mulaney
Dialogue: Never saw it but what you think?

Speaker: ron stallworth
Dialogue: She's a very good Actress.

Speaker: officer mulaney
Dialogue: Y'know you want some of that.

Speaker: ron stallworth
Dialogue: Yeah. Why's that?

Speaker: officer mulaney
Dialogue: He could only want one thing.

Speaker: ron stallworth
Dialogue: What would that be?

Speaker: officer mulaney
Dialogue: You like acting dumb, Y'know.

Speaker: ron stallworth
Dialogue: No, I just like my questions to be answered.

Speaker: ron stallworth
Dialogue: While I've got you both here. Sirs, I'd like to be an Undercover Detective.

Speaker: chief bridges
Dialogue: What Narcotics?

Speaker: ron stallworth
Dialogue: Whatever Department works, Sir.

Speaker: ron stallworth
Dialogue: I know, Sir but I think I could do some good there.

Speaker: ron stallworth
Dialogue: Well, I'm young. I think there's a niche for me. Get In where I can Fit In.

Speaker: chief bridges
Dialogue: Think a lot of yourself, don't cha?

Speaker: ron stallworth
Dialogue: Just trying to be of help, Chief. Plus, I hate working in The Records room. Sgt. Trapp reacts knowing Ron shouldn't have said that about the Records Room. CHIEF BRIDGES looks at Ron, matter of fact.

Speaker: chief bridges
Dialogue: Well, I think Records is a good place for you to start, Rookie.

Speaker: ron stallworth
Dialogue: Chief, want me clean shaven?

Speaker: chief bridges
Dialogue: Keep it. I like the look.

Speaker: landers
Dialogue: Need a File on a Toad.

Speaker: ron stallworth
Dialogue: No Toads here.

Speaker: landers
Dialogue: Excuse me?

Speaker: ron stallworth
Dialogue: I said, I don't have any Toads. I do have Human Beings and if you give me their names I can pull the Files.

Speaker: landers
Dialogue: Heard you think you Hot Shit but you ain't nuthin' but a Cold Fart. Name's Maurice, Maurice Smalls...That respectful enough for you, Officer Toad.

Speaker: ron stallworth
Dialogue: Hello. CHIEF BRIDGES  It's Bridges. You sleeping?

Speaker: ron stallworth
Dialogue: Yes, Chief, I was. Just worked a Night Shift.

Speaker: ron stallworth
Dialogue: Yes Sir, see you then. Thank You. Thank You.

Speaker: flip
Dialogue: Rookie, you're late.

Speaker: ron stallworth
Dialogue: Sorry, it won't happen again.

Speaker: ron stallworth
Dialogue: The Nightclub?

Speaker: chief bridges
Dialogue: No, Emmanuel Missionary Baptist Church!!!

Speaker: ron stallworth
Dialogue: Born Ready.

Speaker: ron stallworth
Dialogue: Any chance this thing Fucks Up? FLIP Fuck yeah.

Speaker: ron stallworth
Dialogue: Then what?

Speaker: jimmy
Dialogue: Just stick to The Game Plan.

Speaker: ron stallworth
Dialogue: Which is?

Speaker: flip
Dialogue: Improvise. Like Jazz. This isn't some Big Bust. We just want some Intel, that's it.

Speaker: jimmy
Dialogue: What happens if someone offers you a Marijuana Cigarette?

Speaker: ron stallworth
Dialogue: You mean a Joint?

Speaker: jimmy
Dialogue: Yeah.

Speaker: ron stallworth
Dialogue: "Soul Brother, I'm already High on Life. Can you Dig It?"

Speaker: flip
Dialogue: And if someone pulls a Gun on you?

Speaker: ron stallworth
Dialogue: You expecting that?

Speaker: flip
Dialogue: Barrel of a 45's in your face, Finger on the Trigger, now what?

Speaker: ron stallworth
Dialogue: Blood, get that Gun out my face. Peace Love and Soul.

Speaker: flip
Dialogue: Gun is still in your face.

Speaker: flip
Dialogue: Relax, we'll be outside, listening in.

Speaker: ron stallworth
Dialogue: Can I order a Drink at The Bar?

Speaker: jimmy
Dialogue: That's fine, just don't get Shit Faced.

Speaker: flip
Dialogue: Got it?

Speaker: ron stallworth
Dialogue: I got it. I'm gone.

Speaker: ron stallworth
Dialogue: How are you doing, my Soul Sista?

Speaker: ron stallworth
Dialogue: Indeed it is.

Speaker: patrice
Dialogue: Have you heard Brother Kwame speak before?

Speaker: ron stallworth
Dialogue: Who?

Speaker: patrice
Dialogue: Kwame Ture.

Speaker: ron stallworth
Dialogue: Actually, I haven't, I didn't know he changed his name.

Speaker: patrice
Dialogue: Yes, after he moved to Africa. He took the names of Kwame Nkrumah of Ghana and his Mentor Sekou Toure of Guinea to honor The Great Leaders.

Speaker: ron stallworth
Dialogue: That's Heavy. Do you know how he got to Colorado Springs?

Speaker: patrice
Dialogue: The Colorado College Black Student Union invited Brother Ture.

Speaker: ron stallworth
Dialogue: I can dig it. I can dig it. You with The Black Student Union?

Speaker: patrice
Dialogue: I'm The President.

Speaker: ron stallworth
Dialogue: Right On. Right On.

Speaker: patrice
Dialogue: The Black Student Union of Colorado College is honored to bring The Vanguard of Revolutionaries fighting for The Rights of Black People all over The World. Let's show some Black Love to The One and Only, The Former Prime Minister of The Black Panther Party, The Brother Man with The Plan who's stickin'it to the Man, put your Hands together my People... for Our Kwame Ture.

Speaker: kwame ture
Dialogue: Thank you all for coming out tonight, My Beloved Sista's and Brotha's. I Thank you...

Speaker: black mass
Dialogue: BLACK POWER!!! BLACK POWER!!!

Speaker: kwame ture
Dialogue: Is Beauty defined by someone with a Narrow Nose? Thin Lips? White Skin? You ain't got none of that. If your Lips are Thick, Bite them in. Hold your Nose! Don't drink Coffee because it makes you Black!

Speaker: ron stallworth
Dialogue: Right on!!! Right On!!!

Speaker: ron stallworth
Dialogue: Brother Ture, do you really think a War between The Black and White Race is inevitable? Kwame pulls Ron in close toward his face. Too close.

Speaker: kwame ture
Dialogue: Brother, arm yourself. Get ready. The Revolution is coming. We must pick up a Gun and prepare ourselves...Trust me, it is coming.

Speaker: ron stallworth
Dialogue: I don't know what you have planned now but maybe I could buy you a Drink?

Speaker: patrice
Dialogue: I'm waiting for Brother Kwame, I have to make sure he gets back safely to the Hotel and he's squared away.

Speaker: ron stallworth
Dialogue: I can dig it.

Speaker: patrice
Dialogue: Maybe, if it's not too late, I'll meet you at The Red Lantern. You know where that is?

Speaker: ron stallworth
Dialogue: I do.

Speaker: patrice
Dialogue: So I'll see you then.

Speaker: ron stallworth
Dialogue: Cool. All Power to All The People.

Speaker: patrice
Dialogue: Sorry I'm late...

Speaker: ron stallworth
Dialogue: Say what?

Speaker: patrice
Dialogue: Yeah, they knew Brother Kwame was in Town. Made us get out the Car. Pigs pulled us over for no reason. Total harassment.

Speaker: ron stallworth
Dialogue: True?

Speaker: patrice
Dialogue: Truth. Do Four Dogs have Four Assholes?

Speaker: landers
Dialogue: All right everybody out the vehicle. Now!!!

Speaker: kwame ture
Dialogue: My Name is Kwame Ture.

Speaker: landers
Dialogue: I know you Black Bastards are holding. What you got in there some Weed, Pills, Heroin?

Speaker: officer cincer
Dialogue: It's clean.

Speaker: landers
Dialogue: You get this Black Panther outta' Colorado Springs before Sunrise. Hear ME??? Or you all go to Jail.

Speaker: kwame ture
Dialogue: Black people were Born in Jail.

Speaker: ron stallworth
Dialogue: Did you see the Officer's names?

Speaker: patrice
Dialogue: I know I should have but the whole thing was so frightening... I didn't. Bro Pope, The Bartender sets the Drink down. Patrice takes a gulp, her hand shaking. Ron observes.

Speaker: ron stallworth
Dialogue: I'm sorry.

Speaker: chief bridges
Dialogue: What was the Room like?

Speaker: ron stallworth
Dialogue: Folks were hanging on every word.

Speaker: chief bridges
Dialogue: Sounds like he had them pretty riled up?

Speaker: ron stallworth
Dialogue: But I'm not sure that means Black Folks were ready to start a Revolution.

Speaker: chief bridges
Dialogue: What makes you think that?

Speaker: ron stallworth
Dialogue: Nobody was talking about that. That wasn't the Mood. Everybody was Cool.

Speaker: chief bridges
Dialogue: So let me get this straight. He told a Crowd of "Black Folks" to get ready for a Race War. That they were going to have to arm themselves and kill Cops. What about that?

Speaker: ron stallworth
Dialogue: Yeah, he said that but I think that was just talk. You know, Rhetoric.

Speaker: flip
Dialogue: That's what I thought too.

Speaker: chief bridges
Dialogue: Thank God, Carmichael has left Colorado Springs. RON STALLWORTH Kwame Ture.

Speaker: chief bridges
Dialogue: What?

Speaker: ron stallworth
Dialogue: He changed his name from Stokely Carmichael to Kwame Ture.

Speaker: chief bridges
Dialogue: I don't care if he changed his name to Muhammad Ali, he's still dangerous.

Speaker: ron stallworth
Dialogue: Did you hear the Story Patrice told me about how the CSPD pulled over her and Ture?

Speaker: chief bridges
Dialogue: No. We didn't hear that.

Speaker: ron stallworth
Dialogue: Kwame Ture, Correct.

Speaker: chief bridges
Dialogue: You getting pretty Chummy with her?

Speaker: ron stallworth
Dialogue: Just doing my job, Chief. Undercover.

Speaker: chief bridges
Dialogue: Yeah and it better not be Under the Cover Of The Sheets.

Speaker: chief bridges
Dialogue: ... you don't know what you would do, you just got here.

Speaker: flip
Dialogue: Good work.

Speaker: jimmy
Dialogue: Rookie.

Speaker: chief bridges
Dialogue: Ron, let's take a walk.

Speaker: chief bridges
Dialogue: I'm transferring you into Intelligence.

Speaker: ron stallworth
Dialogue: What will I be doing, Chief?

Speaker: chief bridges
Dialogue: Intelligence. Chief Bridges walks off. Ron stands there,Jacked!!!

Speaker: pre-recorded message
Dialogue: You have reached The Colorado State Chapter of The Ku Klux Klan. Please leave a message... God Bless White America.

Speaker: ron stallworth
Dialogue: Hello, this is Ron Stallworth calling. Saw your Advertisement in The Colorado Springs Gazette. I'm interested in receiving some Reading Materials. My Phone Number is 403- 9994. Looking forward to you returning my call. God Bless White America.

Speaker: flip
Dialogue: Did I just hear you use your Real Name?

Speaker: ron stallworth
Dialogue: Motherfucker!!!

Speaker: jimmy
Dialogue: Yeah, Motherfuckin' Amateur Hour. What were you thinkin'?

Speaker: ron stallworth
Dialogue: I wasn't.

Speaker: flip
Dialogue: You dialed. Pick it up.

Speaker: ron stallworth
Dialogue: The Organization?

Speaker: ron stallworth
Dialogue: Since you asked- I Hate Niggers, Jews, Mexicans, Spics, Chinks but especially those Niggers and anyone else that does not have pure White Aryan Blood running through their Veins.

Speaker: ron stallworth
Dialogue: ...Every time I think about that Black Baboon putting his Filthy Black Hands on her White as Pure Driven Snow Body I wanna Puke!!!

Speaker: ron stallworth
Dialogue: Looking forward to meeting you.

Speaker: flip
Dialogue: Good Luck Ron with your New Redneck Friend.

Speaker: ron stallworth
Dialogue: Well... they want to meet me First.

Speaker: ron stallworth
Dialogue: I'll need another Undercover to go in my place.

Speaker: ron stallworth
Dialogue: You think?

Speaker: ron stallworth
Dialogue: Damn. OMITTED

Speaker: chief bridges
Dialogue: I can't spare any Men.

Speaker: sgt. trapp
Dialogue: I've looked over the Logs and it seems you can spare them.

Speaker: chief bridges
Dialogue: Sgt. Trapp, Ron spoke to the Man on the phone. When they hear the Voice of one of my Guys, they'll know the difference.

Speaker: ron stallworth
Dialogue: Why so, Chief?

Speaker: chief bridges
Dialogue: Want me to spell it out? He'll know the difference between how a White Man talks and a Negro.

Speaker: ron stallworth
Dialogue: What does a Black Man talk like?

Speaker: sgt. trapp
Dialogue: Ron, I think what The Chief is trying to say is...

Speaker: ron stallworth
Dialogue: ...If you don't mind, I'd like to talk for myself, Thank You. How exactly does a Black Man talk?

Speaker: chief bridges
Dialogue: You know... YOU KNOW!!!

Speaker: ron stallworth
Dialogue: Chief, some of us can speak King's English and Jive. I happen to be fluent in both.

Speaker: chief bridges
Dialogue: Ron, how do you propose to make this Investigation? RON STALLWORTH I have established contact and created some familiarity with The Klansmen over the phone. I will continue that role but another Officer, a White Officer, will play Me when they meet Face to Face.

Speaker: chief bridges
Dialogue: ...My Point Exactly!!!...

Speaker: ron stallworth
Dialogue: Black Ron Stallworth on The phone and White Ron Stallworth Face to Face, so there becomes a combined Ron Stallworth.

Speaker: chief bridges
Dialogue: Can you do that?

Speaker: ron stallworth
Dialogue: I believe we can... With The Right White Man.

Speaker: chief bridges
Dialogue: If anything happens to my Man there won't be Two Ron Stallworths. There'll be none.

Speaker: flip
Dialogue: You're late.

Speaker: ron stallworth
Dialogue: I'm sorry. It won't happen again.

Speaker: jimmy
Dialogue: I heard that somewhere before.

Speaker: flip
Dialogue: Hey, Jimmy when's the last time they let a Rookie head up an Investigation. Oh that's right, NEVER.

Speaker: ron stallworth
Dialogue: Whereabout?

Speaker: flip
Dialogue: Pueblo.

Speaker: jimmy
Dialogue: What's that commute like?

Speaker: flip
Dialogue: Jimmy, I'm glad you asked, straight-

Speaker: jimmy
Dialogue: Long ride.

Speaker: flip
Dialogue: What do we listen to?

Speaker: ron stallworth
Dialogue: KWYD. Christian Talk in The Morning, although the Signal starts to cut out near Pueblo. On the way back I go for 102.7 to get my Allman Brothers Fix. Only I have to change every time that British Fag David Bowie pipes on.

Speaker: jimmy
Dialogue: I love Bowie.

Speaker: ron stallworth
Dialogue: Remember you've got to retain the details of what you share with them so I can be White Ron Stallworth.

Speaker: flip
Dialogue: Jimmy, I always wanted to grow up to be Black, all my Heroes were Black Guys. Willie Mays...

Speaker: jimmy
Dialogue: Basket catch.

Speaker: flip
Dialogue: Wilt The Stilt...

Speaker: jimmy
Dialogue: A record hundred points in the game. FLIP But my favorite is O.J.

Speaker: jimmy
Dialogue: Love Fuckin' O.J. Orenthal James Simpson.

Speaker: ron stallworth
Dialogue: Well, don't share your Love of The Brothers with these Guys. For you, it's The Osmonds.

Speaker: flip
Dialogue: I get to play you but you don't get to play me. Jimmy, does that sound fair?

Speaker: jimmy
Dialogue: Not to me. RON STALLWORTH Fair? I get to play you and Jimmy and all the other guys in the Station... Everyday.

Speaker: flip
Dialogue: Walter Breachway.

Speaker: ron stallworth
Dialogue: Become Walter's Friend, get invited back.

Speaker: flip
Dialogue: Look at you. Is that it, Sir?

Speaker: ron stallworth
Dialogue: I'm on the phone with The Klan, You see them in person...

Speaker: ron stallworth
Dialogue: ...And you need to sound like my voice.

Speaker: jimmy
Dialogue: Oh Boy.

Speaker: ron stallworth
Dialogue: Just repeat after me.

Speaker: flip
Dialogue: The Godfather.

Speaker: flip
Dialogue: Look a'here, some people say we got a lot of malice. Some say it's a lotta nerve. CLOSE - RON STALLWORTH

Speaker: ron stallworth
Dialogue: I saw we won't quit moving 'Til we get what we deserve.

Speaker: flip
Dialogue: I saw we won't quit moving 'Til we get what we deserve.

Speaker: ron stallworth
Dialogue: We've been buked and we've been scorned. We've been treated bad, talked about.

Speaker: flip
Dialogue: We've been buked and we've been scorned. We've been treated bad, talked about.

Speaker: ron stallworth
Dialogue: As Just as sure as you're born But just as sure as it take.

Speaker: flip
Dialogue: As Just as sure as you're born But just as sure as it take.

Speaker: ron stallworth
Dialogue: Two eyes to make a pair, huh.

Speaker: flip
Dialogue: Two eyes to make a pair, huh.

Speaker: ron stallworth
Dialogue: Brother, we can't quit until we get our share.

Speaker: flip
Dialogue: Brother, we can't quit until we get our share.

Speaker: ron stallworth
Dialogue: Say it loud. I'm Black and I'm proud.

Speaker: flip
Dialogue: Say it loud. I'm Black and I'm proud. RON STALLWORTH Jimmy, join us.

Speaker: ron stallworth, flip and jimmy
Dialogue: Say it loud. I'm Black and I'm proud. Say it loud. I'm Black and I'm proud.

Speaker: jimmy
Dialogue: Don't forget to lose that Star of David around your neck.

Speaker: ron stallworth
Dialogue: You're Jewish?

Speaker: ron stallworth
Dialogue: It's Walter. Ron writes down The Truck's Plate

Speaker: felix
Dialogue: Ron Stallworth? FLIP That's me. And you must be Walter.

Speaker: felix
Dialogue: Name's Felix.

Speaker: flip
Dialogue: I was told I'd be meeting with Walter Breachway.

Speaker: felix
Dialogue: Change of plans, Mack. I'm gonna need you to hop in The Pickup.

Speaker: flip
Dialogue: Okay, well how about I just follow you...

Speaker: felix
Dialogue: ...No Can Do. You come with me. Security.

Speaker: felix
Dialogue: You for The White Race, Ron?

Speaker: flip
Dialogue: Hell Yeah!!! Been having some trouble lately with these Local Niggers.

Speaker: felix
Dialogue: Since The Civil War it's always trouble with Niggers. Walter said something about your Sister? FLIP Makes me Sick.

Speaker: flip
Dialogue: But it's also the, like, camaraderie I'm looking for...with The Klan.

Speaker: felix
Dialogue: Da Fuck did you say?

Speaker: flip
Dialogue: Camaraderie...?

Speaker: felix
Dialogue: No. The other word.

Speaker: flip
Dialogue: The Klan...?

Speaker: felix
Dialogue: ...Not "The Klan." It's The Organization. The Invisible Empire has managed to stay Invisible for a reason. Do Not Ever Use That Word. You understand?

Speaker: flip
Dialogue: I overstand... Right. The Organization.

Speaker: felix
Dialogue: Check this Shit out... you're never gonna believe it.

Speaker: flip
Dialogue: What?

Speaker: felix
Dialogue: There's a Jig on our Bumper.

Speaker: jimmy
Dialogue: He sees us. Back Off. Ron eases on the Gas.

Speaker: felix
Dialogue: Let's be ready, case we gotta go and shoot us A Alabama Porch Monkey.

Speaker: flip
Dialogue: Pull out what?

Speaker: felix
Dialogue: Under the seat!!!

Speaker: flip
Dialogue: Ready to go.

Speaker: felix
Dialogue: That's right, Porch Monkey. Don't be Messin' with us...

Speaker: flip
Dialogue: ...The Organization. FELIX Not so fast, Buddy Boy.

Speaker: ron stallworth
Dialogue: Just a Bar.

Speaker: jimmy
Dialogue: Probably.

Speaker: walter
Dialogue: Ron. Glad you could make it. Walter Breachway, Chapter President.

Speaker: flip
Dialogue: I appreciate you inviting me out.

Speaker: walter
Dialogue: I've been impressed with our phone conversations. I feel you have some fine ideas that could help The Cause.

Speaker: flip
Dialogue: I meant every word I said.

Speaker: flip
Dialogue: That right?

Speaker: walter
Dialogue: It became my salvation. After I was shot and wounded by some Niggers. My Wife... Savagely Raped by a whole Pack of 'EM, and not a one went to Jail.

Speaker: jimmy
Dialogue: Never happened. Ron cracks a smile.

Speaker: walter
Dialogue: They're taking over. That's all you see on the TV Anymore. Niggers. Niggers selling Soap, Niggers selling Automobiles, Niggers selling Toothpaste, Niggers, Niggers, Niggers.

Speaker: ivanhoe
Dialogue: Wasn't long ago them Sumbitches wasn't on no TV.

Speaker: walter
Dialogue: You forgetting Uncle Ben and Aunt Jemima.

Speaker: ivanhoe
Dialogue: Dang!!! You know, I gotta say I kinda like dem' Niggers...Rice and Pancakes. Ivanhoe shakes hands with Flip. IVANHOE  Name's Ivanhoe, by the way.

Speaker: ron stallworth
Dialogue: Mad at Sanford and Son and Flip Wilson.

Speaker: walter
Dialogue: All you get now is how we gotta' cater to them. We gotta' get us some "Minorities". Watch ya' mouth, don't say this, don't say that, be nice, they're not Colored...

Speaker: felix
Dialogue: Negros...

Speaker: ivanhoe
Dialogue: ...Blacks...

Speaker: walter
Dialogue: ...Afro-Americans...

Speaker: flip
Dialogue: ...FUCK. How 'bout just Fuckin'? Niggers. Make it Fuckin' simple.

Speaker: all
Dialogue: NIGGERS!!!

Speaker: flip
Dialogue: I been saying this stuff for years.

Speaker: felix
Dialogue: You ain't the only one.

Speaker: flip
Dialogue: You don't know how good it is to hear someone that gets it.

Speaker: ivanhoe
Dialogue: You know, Cross burnings. Marches and stuff so people don't Fuck wit' us. FLIP I'm tired of people Fuckin' with me.

Speaker: walter
Dialogue: You come to the right place cuz' Nobody Fucks with us. How much you know about The History?

Speaker: flip
Dialogue: Some...I could know more.

Speaker: walter
Dialogue: We'll teach you.

Speaker: ivanhoe
Dialogue: This year's gonna be big for us.

Speaker: flip
Dialogue: How so?

Speaker: ivanhoe
Dialogue: BOOM!!! We're gonna make Fireworks, yes we are...

Speaker: walter
Dialogue: ...Ivanhoe talking nonsense again. Kid can't hold his Beer fer Shit. The Organization is strictly Non- Violent...

Speaker: ivanhoe
Dialogue: ...Like dat Dead Nigger Martin Luther Coon.

Speaker: flip
Dialogue: Gotcha.

Speaker: walter
Dialogue: Say, Ron? Mind coming with me?

Speaker: flip
Dialogue: Where to? FELIX You Undercover or something? You ask too many questions. Let's GO!!!

Speaker: jimmy
Dialogue: Where they going?

Speaker: ron stallworth
Dialogue: Lost the damn signal.

Speaker: walter
Dialogue: Congrats you passed The Mustard.

Speaker: flip
Dialogue: Now we're talkin'.

Speaker: walter
Dialogue: Fill these out and Mail 'em to The National Headquarters. Once they send your Membership Card, you'll be able to participate in our Programs.

Speaker: flip
Dialogue: Alcoa Can't wait.

Speaker: ivanhoe
Dialogue: I like those Commercials. WALTER Imperial Tax to become a Member: Ten Dollars for The Year. Fifteen Dollar Chapter Fee. Robes and Hoods not included, that's Extra.

Speaker: felix
Dialogue: Fuckin' Inflation.

Speaker: flip
Dialogue: I can't thank you Brothers enough.

Speaker: walter
Dialogue: Pleasure, is all ours.

Speaker: felix
Dialogue: You're not a Jew, right?

Speaker: flip
Dialogue: You trying to offend me?

Speaker: felix
Dialogue: It's Protocol.

Speaker: flip
Dialogue: 'Course I'm no Stinkin' Kike.

Speaker: walter
Dialogue: We gotta ask it, is all. I'm satisfied. How about you Guys?

Speaker: felix
Dialogue: Smells Kosher to me.

Speaker: flip
Dialogue: Stop fuckin' 'round. WALTER Felix, cut it out.

Speaker: flip
Dialogue: You have me dressed like one of the Beverly Hillbillies for Chrissakes. I felt too Redneck for those Guys.

Speaker: ron stallworth
Dialogue: They liked you.

Speaker: flip
Dialogue: Except for that Felix Guy. Do not ride his Bumper like that! Two car lengths!

Speaker: ron stallworth
Dialogue: You got The Papers? They want you to join.

Speaker: flip
Dialogue: Technically they want you to join.

Speaker: ron stallworth
Dialogue: They want a Black Man to join The Ku Klux Klan. I'd call that Mission Impossible. Double Success.

Speaker: ron stallworth
Dialogue: Enough that we'd like to dig deeper. One of the Men discussed plans for a possible Attack...

Speaker: flip
Dialogue: ...I wouldn't give him that much credit. These Yahoos like to Boast.

Speaker: ron stallworth
Dialogue: Either way, we're looking for full support from The Department.

Speaker: patrice
Dialogue: The next day when we dropped Brother Kwame off at the Airport he told me The Black Power Movement needed Strong Sistah's like me to lead the fight against Capitalist oppression and The Politicians and Pigs who perpetuate it. His words almost made that whole Pig Nightmare worth while...

Speaker: ron stallworth
Dialogue: I don't really use that word.

Speaker: patrice
Dialogue: What word?

Speaker: ron stallworth
Dialogue: Pigs.

Speaker: patrice
Dialogue: What else would you call them?

Speaker: ron stallworth
Dialogue: Cops... Police... PATRICE Bunch of Racist Cops on a Power Trip.

Speaker: ron stallworth
Dialogue: So you think all Cops are Racist?

Speaker: patrice
Dialogue: It only takes One to pull a Trigger on a Innocent Sister or Brother.

Speaker: ron stallworth
Dialogue: He's got some good ideas. I don't agree with all of them but he's a smart Brother who's worth hearing.

Speaker: patrice
Dialogue: Are you Down for The Liberation of Black People?

Speaker: ron stallworth
Dialogue: Do we always have to talk about Politics?

Speaker: patrice
Dialogue: What's more important?

Speaker: ron stallworth

Dialogue: Indeed it is.

Dialogue: Come on Man, this is just Straight-Up Offensive. We're talking about someone who's gonna be our Brother in a couple months. Is there a fuckin' Star of David around his Neck? Does Ron got a YA-MA-KA on his HEAD for Pete's sake?

Dialogue: You think?

Dialogue: I think a lot.

Dialogue: That's the biggest Jewish Conspiracy. 8 Million Jews killed? Concentration camps? Never happened. Where's the proof?

Speaker: flip

Dialogue: I don't get High. I drink.

Dialogue: Haven't seen the Footage.

Speaker: felix
Dialogue: Fake. Jews run Hollywood.

Dialogue: Yeah, keep drivin' you Black Spearchucker!!! Piece a Shit Nigger!!!

Dialogue: Felix, you still want me to take your Jew Detector Test!!!

Dialogue: Everybody go Home NOW!!! Get Outta HERE!!! GO HOME!!!

Speaker: ron stallworth
Dialogue: Is he gonna hear about it, Sarge?

Dialogue: I didn't say it in there with Trapp but that Peckerwood had a Gun in my Face and he was an Ass Hair away from pulling The Trigger.

Dialogue: And he didn't.

Speaker: flip
Dialogue: But he could have and then I woulda been Dead... for what? Stoppin' some Jerkoffs from playing Dress up?

Dialogue: Flip, it's Intel.

Speaker: flip
Dialogue: I'm not risking my Life to prevent some Rednecks from lighting a couple Sticks on Fire.

Dialogue: This is the Job. What's your problem?

Speaker: flip
Dialogue: Ron, you're my problem.

Speaker: ron stallworth
Dialogue: How's that?

Speaker: flip
Dialogue: For you it's not a job, it's a Crusade. It's not personal nor should it be.

Speaker: flip
Dialogue: Why should I?

Speaker: ron stallworth
Dialogue: Because you're Jewish, Brother. The So-Called Chosen People. Flip gets pissed and flies up into Ron face. They are nose to nose.

Speaker: flip
Dialogue: What?

Speaker: ron stallworth
Dialogue: You're passing for a WASP!!! White Anglo Saxon Protestant, All-American Hot Dog, Cherry Pie White Boy. It's what some Light-Skinned Black Folks do, they pass for White.

Speaker: flip
Dialogue: Of course it does.

Speaker: ron stallworth
Dialogue: Then why you acting like you ain't got skin in the Game!

Speaker: flip
Dialogue: That's my Damn Business!

Dialogue: It's our Business.

Speaker: ron stallworth
Dialogue: Good afternoon. My name is Ron Stallworth, calling from Colorado Springs. How are you today, Sir?

Speaker: pleasant man
Dialogue: Quite well, Ron. What can I do for you?

Speaker: ron stallworth
Dialogue: I'm calling because I desperately want to participate in my Chapter's Honorary Events but I can't until I receive my Membership Card.

Speaker: ron stallworth
Dialogue: Thank you. Who am I speaking with?

Speaker: ron stallworth
Dialogue: I'm sorry... did you just say you're Devin Davis?

Speaker: ron stallworth
Dialogue: ...Grand Wizard of The Ku Klux Klan? That Devin Davis?

Speaker: ron stallworth
Dialogue: Really? National Director too?

Speaker: ron stallworth
Dialogue: I'm honored to be speaking with you. I'm not afraid to say it...I consider you a True White American Hero. DEVIN DAVIS Are there any other kind?

Speaker: devin davis
Dialogue: And I'm just happy to be talking to a True White American.

Speaker: ron stallworth
Dialogue: Amen, Mr. Davis. Seems like there's less and less of us these days. Now about that Membership Card...

Speaker: devin davis
Dialogue: ...I understand the situation. We've been having some Administrative problems that have caused a backlog. ...Tell you what, Ron. I'll see to it personally that your Membership Card is processed and sent out today.

Speaker: ron
Dialogue: Thank you, Mr. Davis. I can't express to you how much I appreciate this.

Speaker: devin davis
Dialogue: The pleasure is all mine. I look forward to meeting you in person One Day and God Bless White America.

Speaker: landers
Dialogue: Watch where you're going. You could get hurt like that Hot Shot.

Dialogue: That Cop that pulled Kwame Ture over that night... was it Landers?

Speaker: flip
Dialogue: How'd you know?

Dialogue: I can smell em' a Mile away now.

Dialogue: He's been a Bad Cop for a long time.

Speaker: ron stallworth
Dialogue: Yeah?

Dialogue: Does that kinda' Shit all the time. Few years ago, he allegedly Shot and Killed a Black Kid... he said he had a Gun. The Kid wasn't the type.

Dialogue: Flip, why do you tolerate this?

Speaker: flip
Dialogue: We're a family. Good or Bad. We stick together. You wanna be the Guy that Rats him out?

Speaker: ron stallworth
Dialogue: Yeah, reminds me of another Group. Ron finished. Flip steps away buttoning his shirt.

Speaker: walter
Dialogue: ... and then you got what used to be a decent Bar, The Hide N Seek Room, turned into a Filthy Fag Bar overnight.

Speaker: flip
Dialogue: Fuckin' Fags everywhere these days.

Dialogue: They're trying to Colonize. First they get their own Bars, then they want Equal Treatment...

Dialogue: ...Forget Dem Fags... Some of these Guys Army-trained?

Dialogue: A lot of 'em are. Fort Carson...

Dialogue: Steve and Jerry.

Dialogue: Gezzus H. Christ!

Dialogue: Hey, Ron! Take my Forty-Five Auto wanna see what you can do. FELIX Maybe you'll get dat Nigger next time.

Dialogue: That's one deaaaaaad Jungle Bunny!!!

Dialogue: Bernie Casey's a Badd Brother.

Dialogue: Cleopatra Jones was the one. It's about time We see a strong Sister like that...

Dialogue: You don't dig Pam Grier? She's Fine as Wine and twice as Mellow.

Dialogue: Pam Grier is doing her Thing but in real life it's just Pigs killing Black Folks.

Dialogue: What if a Cop was trying to make things better.

Dialogue: From the inside?

Dialogue: Yeah, from the inside.

Dialogue: You can't make things better from the inside. It's a Racist System.

Dialogue: So just give up?

Dialogue: No!!! We fight for what Black People really need! BLACK LIBERATION!!!

Speaker: ron stallworth
Dialogue: Can't you do that from the inside!

Speaker: patrice
Dialogue: No! You can't. White Man won't let us.

Speaker: ron stallworth
Dialogue: I know how that feels. I'm Two damn people all the time! PATRICE But you shouldn't be! We shouldn't have a War going on inside ourselves. Why can't we just be Black People?

Speaker: ron stallworth
Dialogue: Because we're not there yet!

Speaker: patrice
Dialogue: Well, I'm tired of waiting!

Speaker: ron stallworth
Dialogue: Shaft or Superfly?

Speaker: patrice
Dialogue: What?

Speaker: ron stallworth
Dialogue: Pick one, Shaft or Superfly?

Speaker: patrice
Dialogue: A Private Detective over a Pimp any day and twice on Sundays.

Dialogue: Richard Roundtree or Ron O'Neal?

Dialogue: Richard Roundtree. Pimps Ain't No Heroes.

Speaker: ron stallworth
Dialogue: Ron O'Neal isn't a Pimp. He's just playing one.

Dialogue: That image does damage to Our People.

Speaker: ron stallworth
Dialogue: JESUS CHRIST!!! Give it a rest.

Dialogue: I can't you JIVE TURKEY.

Dialogue: Who was that?

Dialogue: What?

Dialogue: You got a Twin.

Speaker: felix
Dialogue: So you don't know that Nigger?

Dialogue: Oh, that's that Nigger I keep in the woodpile.

Dialogue: And y'know what? That loud mouth Black Student Union Bitch that's been in the paper complaining about the Police. She was there.

Dialogue: Nice one. RON STALLWORTH Is Patrice a Target?

Dialogue: Maybe.

Dialogue: We got Active Duty Soldiers from Fort Carson. Going to the CID with this.

Dialogue: That's us The Stallworth Boys.

Dialogue: I called to warn you, but you must have already taken off.

Dialogue: Ron, I wasn't raised Jewish. It wasn't a part of my Life. So I never thought much about being Jewish, was just another White Kid, didn't even have my Bar Mitzvah. No Chanukah for me. Christmas. In this job, you try to keep things at a distance. You put up a Shield so you don't feel anything... This shit is deep. When that Fuck Felix had me in that room and I kept having to deny my heritage...I have been passing. OMITTED.

Speaker: ron stallworth
Dialogue: Where'd you find them? PATRICE I found this one on my Car. But they're all over The Neighborhood, too.

Speaker: ron stallworth
Dialogue: It's Real.

Dialogue: This is intimidation.

Speaker: ron stallworth
Dialogue: Clearly, this is about the Black Student Union and you.

Speaker: patrice
Dialogue: Me?

Speaker: ron stallworth
Dialogue: You've been outspoken about the incident with the Police when Brother Kwame was here.

Speaker: patrice
Dialogue: So the next time they'll have a Burning Cross out Front.

Speaker: ron stallworth
Dialogue: They're trying to get to you, like you said they want to intimidate make themselves feared. If you don't let 'em scare you. They got nothing. But keep your eyes open. Be Cool.

Speaker: odetta
Dialogue: That's the problem we've been too Cool!

Speaker: hakeem
Dialogue: Way too Cool!

Speaker: ron stallworth
Dialogue: Maybe the both of you should call The Cops. HAKEEM How we know this ain't some of the KKK's Honky-Pig-Partners passing out this Shit!

Speaker: ivanhoe
Dialogue: Soak the Wood in Kerosene, we light a Cig on a pack of matches. Gives us time to Beat It before The Cross catches Fire. Safeguard against CSPD.

Dialogue: Must be quite a sight.

Dialogue: The Best. You can see it for Miles. Freaks out The Jew Media and puts Niggers on their Nigger Toes.

Dialogue: A lot of these Guys in The Army?

Dialogue: Yeah, even got a few in Active Duty.

Dialogue: Just finished my Second Tour in Nam.

Dialogue: Oh yeah? Know anything about C-4?

Dialogue: Send another one.

Dialogue: Damn, that's The Second One. Pigs are out tonight.

Speaker: felix
Dialogue: That makes Three Piggy Wiggys.

Speaker: ron stallworth
Dialogue: Good job, Men.

Speaker: devin davis
Dialogue: ...I don't share this with many people, but My family had a Colored Housekeeper growing up. Her name was Pinky. She was probably the closest Woman to me other than Mother.

Speaker: ron stallworth
Dialogue: That surprises me.

Speaker: devin davis
Dialogue: I know. People think I hate Negroes. I don't and The Organization doesn't either.

Speaker: devin davis
Dialogue: They just need to be with their own. That's what Pinky would say, she had no problem with Segregation because she wanted to be with her own kind.

Speaker: ron stallworth
Dialogue: Sounds like she was a Mammy to you.

Speaker: devin davis
Dialogue: She was. You ever see "Gone with the Wind"? Pinky was my Hattie McDaniel. She won an Oscar for Best Supporting Actress.

Speaker: ron stallworth
Dialogue: You were Scarlett and she was Mammy.

Speaker: devin davis
Dialogue: That's right. When she passed away it was like we lost one of the Family. RON STALLWORTH A good Nigger's funny that way. In that sense they're like a Dog. They can get real close to you and when you lose em'. Just breaks your heart.

Speaker: devin davis
Dialogue: Well said Ron.

Speaker: ron stallworth
Dialogue: I knew a Nigger once.

Speaker: devin davis
Dialogue: Didja?

Speaker: ron stallworth
Dialogue: Yeah. Nigger lived across the street from us. I must of been Six or Seven. His nickname was Butter Biscuit.

Speaker: devin davis
Dialogue: How'd he get that nickname?

Speaker: ron stallworth
Dialogue: He loved his Mama's Butter Biscuits.

Speaker: devin davis
Dialogue: Yum Yum!!!

Speaker: ron stallworth
Dialogue: Me and Butter Biscuit played together everyday. One day My Father came home early from work and told me I couldn't play with him anymore because I was White and Butter Biscuit was a Nigger.

Speaker: devin davis
Dialogue: That's rich.

Speaker: ron stallworth
Dialogue: Ain't it.

Speaker: devin davis
Dialogue: Your Father sounds like a Terrific Man.

Speaker: ron stallworth
Dialogue: Thanks, Buddy. DEVIN DAVIS Well, you're an upstanding White Christian Man. I tell you this is why we need more people like us in Public Office. To get this Country back on Track.

Speaker: ron stallworth
Dialogue: Amen.

Speaker: devin davis
Dialogue: For America to Achieve our Greatness... again.

Speaker: ron stallworth
Dialogue: Absolutely. Sure wish we had the chance to chat Face to Face.

Speaker: devin davis
Dialogue: In due time, my friend, in due time. I'll be in Colorado Springs for your initiation...

Speaker: ron stallworth
Dialogue: You'll be in Colorado Springs?

Speaker: devin davis
Dialogue: You bet your Mayflower Society Ass I will.

Speaker: ron stallworth
Dialogue: That would be quite an Honor.

Speaker: ron stallworth
Dialogue: I'll have to think about this. My father is very ill and he lives in El Paso. I won't have the time.

Speaker: walter
Dialogue: I think it's time for some new Blood to get in here. I'm planning to step down as your President.

Speaker: felix
Dialogue: We just met this Guy. IVANHOE He just walked in off the street. FELIX Let me ask a question. Is there anybody here that is willing to put their Neck on the Line for Ron?

Speaker: walter
Dialogue: I will vouch for Ron.

Speaker: flip
Dialogue: It's a Big Honor but I can't accept. Problem is, what you Good Men need is a President who will be constant, on CALL Day In, Day Out. I'll be back and forth between here and Dallas.

Speaker: ron stallworth
Dialogue: El Paso, Flip, El Paso...

Speaker: walter
Dialogue: Dallas? I thought it was El Paso.

Speaker: flip
Dialogue: Did I say Dallas?

Speaker: walter
Dialogue: You sure did.

Speaker: felix
Dialogue: Ron which One is it?

Speaker: ivanhoe
Dialogue: Make up your mind.

Speaker: flip
Dialogue: Dallas is where my Plane layover is. El Paso is where my sick Father is.

Speaker: ivanhoe
Dialogue: Dallas, where they killed that Nigger Lover Kennedy. FELIX Where you learned that?

Speaker: ivanhoe
Dialogue: I can read.

Speaker: flip
Dialogue: I just hope my Father isn't cared for by some Texicano Spic Nurse.

Speaker: walter
Dialogue: We'll pray for ya Pop's health.

Speaker: ivanhoe
Dialogue: And Big Spic Teets!!!

Speaker: ron stallworth
Dialogue: I'm anxious to meet you and it will be something I share with my Family for Generations to come.

Speaker: devin davis
Dialogue: I'm eager to meet you too, Ron.

Speaker: ron stallworth
Dialogue: Say, Mr. Davis... I just have to ask. Aren't you ever concerned about some Smart-Aleck Negro calling you and pretending to be White?

Speaker: devin davis
Dialogue: No, I can always tell when I'm talking to a Negro.

Speaker: ron stallworth
Dialogue: How so? DEVIN DAVIS Take you, for example. I can tell you are a pure Aryan White Man by the way you pronounce certain words.

Speaker: ron stallworth
Dialogue: Any examples?

Speaker: devin davis
Dialogue: Take the word "are". A pure Aryan like you or I would say it correctly... like "are". Negroes pronounce it "are-uh".

Speaker: ron stallworth
Dialogue: You are so White... Right. I want to thank you for this Lesson because if you had not brought it to my attention, I would never have noticed the difference between how We talk and how Negroes talk.

Speaker: devin davis
Dialogue: That's what I've heard, Ron. You have a nice day.

Speaker: ron stallworth
Dialogue: You too, Sir. God Bless White America. Ron hangs up, laughing. He calls to Sgt. Trapp:

Speaker: ron stallworth
Dialogue: Not at all. Just... finishing a Meal.

Speaker: flip
Dialogue: I don't carry it on me All The Time.

Speaker: felix
Dialogue: I got ya covered.

Speaker: flip
Dialogue: Won't happen again.

Speaker: flip
Dialogue: What's gonna happen next Sunday?

Speaker: felix
Dialogue: The War is gonna come to us.

Speaker: flip
Dialogue: Fuck ya'.

Speaker: ivanhoe
Dialogue: Looks like we got ourselves another Soldier.

Speaker: felix
Dialogue: Just make sure that when you're at The Steakhouse, you've got your new friend with Ya.

Speaker: ivanhoe
Dialogue: And give it a name.

Speaker: felix
Dialogue: About what?

Speaker: connie
Dialogue: Killin' 'em.

Speaker: felix
Dialogue: Never think twice about Killin' Niggers. CONNIE Won't be able to take it back.

Speaker: felix
Dialogue: They're da' first of many Niggers that must die, Honey Bun.

Speaker: connie
Dialogue: I know. It's just... becoming so real. It's always seemed like a dream.

Speaker: felix
Dialogue: I know. It's just so beautiful. We're cleansing this Country of a backwards Race of Monkey's. First the Spooks then the Kikes.

Speaker: connie
Dialogue: I love when you do that, Honey.

Speaker: felix
Dialogue: My Old Man always told me good things come to those who wait.

Speaker: connie
Dialogue: Thank you for bringing me into you Life. For loving me like you do and giving me a purpose, direction.

Speaker: felix
Dialogue: Y'know, this will be the Shot heard around The World. CONNIE The New Boston Tea Party. FELIX Honey Bun, one day, The Great Historians will write about us like that. They'll say we were the Patriots that saved America. You and me. We turned the Tide. Saved our True White Race... it fact, saved an entire Nation and brought it back to its Glorious Destiny.

Speaker: connie
Dialogue: In a way, we're The New Founding Fathers.

Speaker: felix
Dialogue: Yes we are... Martha.

Speaker: connie
Dialogue: Indeed we are... George. The Couple Kiss each other passionately.

Speaker: ron stallworth
Dialogue: Agent... Y? EXT. OLD ABANDONED BREWSTER'S FACTORY - DAY

Speaker: agent y
Dialogue: Names of Chapter Members?

Dialogue: What is this about?

Dialogue: Two Names on your list work at NORAD.

Speaker: ron stallworth
Dialogue: The Two Mystery men. Steve and Jerry?

Dialogue: Their real names are Harry Dricks and Kevin Nelson. Two Clowns with Top Security clearances. These Klansmen are in charge of monitoring our Safety.

Dialogue: Klan...?

Dialogue: You won't see this on the News. For obvious reasons but I thought it might be of interest to you.

Speaker: ron stallworth
Dialogue: If you know about an attack, I need to know when.

Speaker: agent y
Dialogue: You're the one with the Impressive Investigation.

Speaker: ron stallworth
Dialogue: But... can't you, The FBI pitch in?

Speaker: agent y
Dialogue: Federal Bureau of Investigation?

Speaker: felix
Dialogue: Flip, I'm starting to trust you. I'm gonna tell you something none of our Brothers know. My lil' sister married a Nigger. Now I got a lil' Nigger Niece and a lil' Nigger Nephew. Jesus Christ, The World's going to Hell in a Handbasket! Do me a favor, don't tell nobody. Cuz' if you do, I'm gonna have to shoot you dead. I'm serious.

Dialogue: Thanks for sharing.

Speaker: ron stallworth
Dialogue: You can hate me all you want to, just promise me you won't go to The Protest.

Speaker: patrice
Dialogue: I'm going. We're going. What are you talking about?

Speaker: ron stallworth
